channel.title: Fog of War Discussion
channel.description:
Well, I've been attempting to remove Fog of War since last month, and it has been a very difficult task. I know that Winterlove was one of the few to figure it out, and I was thinking.. why not work together to find out how to get rid of it? So far, I've managed to make VERY small progress, finding interesting things to do with clients as a screw around with different things. I've figured that it would be located in client.java or Class25.java. So far, I've figured out how to make the visual area bigger, but I hit the region edges... In Class25.java:
if(j1 < 50 || j1 > 5000)
The 5000 is (what I believe to be) the area of region that you can visually see. There's a lot more region area though, which I can't figure out. I heard that the regions are 50 x 50 tiles? I'm not sure on this.
(20:14:43) <@MissSilabSoft> where your current map chunck is being loaded into (20:14:51) <@MissSilabSoft> you will notice it gets sent into a bigger array (20:15:01) <@MissSilabSoft> you will then notice that that array is full of the mapchunk
So... if you know anything regarding Fog of War, please post it! ;D Thanks, ~Zachera

item.title: Fog of War Discussion
item.dc:creator: @Brett2 Brett`
item.description:
@Brett2 wrote:

[quote=“Zachera, post:15, topic:114827”][quote author=Brett` link=topic=164006.msg2279288#msg2279288 date=1213600814]
Zachera did manage too do something around when he actually posted this topic, he shared with me what he knew.

Pic

400fullscreen.jpg800×640

[/quote]

That’s the same exact region size as I have seen no matter how much research I’ve done. I figured that in order to see more, you need to load multiple regions at once, but I’m not sure how the server would take this in. I’m not even sure if that could work… :s[/quote]

Yeah. i have no idea either. try with a good server base if you are going to attempt this, RS2DV is what I would recommend. but find the part where the client loads the regions and i dunno, have it do it again? like, i dunno.

Read full topic

item.title: Fog of War Discussion
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:12, topic:114827”][quote author=White Castle link=topic=164006.msg1542345#msg1542345 date=1182800418]
A visible area is a 103103 (or possibly 104104) square of 128*128 tiles.
[/quote]

its 104*104, and thats the loaded area, “Tile-Clipping” Still occurs when zooming out.
i havent experimented with this before so im not very knowledgeable on the topic, but instinct would tell me there will be a integer of somesort which will take the distance of tiles to the mainPlayer and check if it is below a certain value, this value may be set by the server or it may be a static integer, again, i have not looked into it before in much detail.

if anyone does work it out, please share =][/quote]25 tiles in x/y direction, are the most that is visible iirc, the camera pitch and yaw are also taken into account

the array that controls it is generated at the loading stage of “preparing visibility map”

Read full topic

item.title: Fog of War Discussion
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

White Castle:

A visible area is a 103103 (or possibly 104104) square of 128*128 tiles.

its 104*104, and thats the loaded area, “Tile-Clipping” Still occurs when zooming out.
i havent experimented with this before so im not very knowledgeable on the topic, but instinct would tell me there will be a integer of somesort which will take the distance of tiles to the mainPlayer and check if it is below a certain value, this value may be set by the server or it may be a static integer, again, i have not looked into it before in much detail.

if anyone does work it out, please share =]

item.title: Fog of War Discussion
item.dc:creator: @MybJames MybJames
item.description:
@MybJames wrote:

along side the tiles being clipped by the view frustum, tile visibility is initially determined by the visibility map (a boolean array array array array [array?]), which must be expanded.
fog of war cannot be removed, but merely expanded so that it is not detected by the user. tracing through the stack is a an exercise in masochism and is relatively futile.

Read full topic

item.title: Fog of War Discussion
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“MybJames, post:3, topic:114827”][quote author=io9 link=topic=164006.msg1534590#msg1534590 date=1182580410]
I remember there was a FoW discussion where psb actually said non-insulting things :O.

Personally, the best thing to do, IMO, is to write a JavaAgent to log what [event] gets fired when and what from, and trace it back to the original method. (ZKM logs?)
[/quote]
Everything you said is totally irrelevant, get a fhkin clue.[/quote]
I don’t see you posting anything “relevant” either.

And yes, my method would work, log all the PaintEvents, and trace them back to the deobbed classes via the ZKM logs, like vbcoderx did. James, go shave your pubes a bit more.

Read full topic
